page.title: 01Filleigh,general description
page.content: Filleigh village is found eight miles to the south-south-east of Barnstaple and four miles from South Molton. The A361 road runs through the village from east to west but the planned link road will by-pass the main village. The village possesses a church, a primary school with aproximately sixty-five children, a post office, sawmills, and village hall. The Fortescue family's house, Castle Hill, is close by and to the east of the village. The area is predominantly farm land (mostly with sheep and cows) and there is the Fortescue Estate Forestry covering 1,200 acres. A number of the houses in the area belong to the Fortescue Estate and are occupied by employees of the Estate. A bus service connects Filleigh with South Molton and Barnstaple.
